newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Pricer to improve in 1997 - president.
newsitem.headline: Pricer to improve in 1997 - president.

text.p: Swedish bar code pricing company Pricer AB will improve financially, but not reach a profit, in 1997, the company's president Erik Danielsson said on Friday.
A new deal with Swedish food retail chain ICA could mean revenues of 30 million crowns in 1997, Danielsson told Reuters in an interview.
The sale of ten percent of the firm's U.S. subsidiary Pricer Inc. will give the parent company about 70 million crowns this year, he said.

In the first nine months of the year, Pricer posted a pretax loss of 137 million crowns, while sales amounted to 8.5 million crowns and order intake was 256 million crowns at the end of the third quarter.
Pricer offers wireless electronic shelf bar codes connected to a central store computer system.
Earlier on Friday, Pricer released news about starting to cooperate with ICA.
"Instead of being a counterpart, ICA will market our products. We will be found in the 100 largest ICA stores pretty quickly. Then, we are really rolling on the Swedish market," Danielsson said.
ICA expects to sell 200,000-300,000 Pricer tags during 1997.
"The price per tag is about 100 crowns and with 300,000 installations in 1997 there could be sales of around 30 million crowns in 1997," Danielsson said.
On Thursday, Pricer said it and U.S. Telxon, which makes radio based local networks (LAN) with handheld computers for retail stores, will establish technical and marketing cooperation.
Therefore, Telxon will invest $10 million in Pricer's U.S. subsidiary Pricer Inc., with Telxon taking a ten percent stake.
The companies will produce a wireless communications system with Telxon's radio technique and Pricer's infra-red technique. The first product will be presented in February.
Danielsson said Pricer's cooperation deal with Telxon was "a very important strategic event in the company's history, comparable with the order from German chain Metro of 120 million crowns in 1995."
"Through the cooperation with Telxon, we jump ten years forward in time in development on the U.S. market," he said.
"I think our U.S. turnover will be as big as our European already in 1999. Telxon gives us credibility and we will have signficant sales in the U.S. already in 1998."

The company will invest the 70 million crowns from the sale of 10 percent in Pricer Inc. in development. At the end of February, a new system will be launched in Germany and mid-year, this system will be established on all markets.
